verses.verse: (1 Sam. 4:17; 22:18) Their priests fell by the sword, And (Job 27:15; Ezek. 24:23) their widows made no lamentation.
Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, (Is. 42:13) Like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
And (1 Sam. 5:6) He beat back His enemies; He put them to a perpetual reproach.
Moreover He rejected the tent of Joseph, And did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
But chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion ((Ps. 87:2)) which He loved.
And He built His (1 Kin. 6:1-38) sanctuary like the heights, Like the earth which He has established forever.
(1 Sam. 16:11, 12; 2 Sam. 7:8) He also chose David His servant, And took him from the sheepfolds;
From following (2 Sam. 7:8; (Is. 40:11)) the ewes that had young He brought him, (2 Sam. 5:2; 1 Chr. 11:2) To shepherd Jacob His people, And Israel His inheritance.
So he shepherded them according to the (1 Kin. 9:4) integrity of his heart, And guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

A Dirge and a Prayer for Israel, Destroyed by Enemies A Psalm of Asaph. [1] O God, the nations have come into (Ps. 74:2) Your inheritance; Your holy temple they have defiled; (2 Kin. 25:9, 10; 2 Chr. 36:17-19; Jer. 26:18; 52:12-14; Mic. 3:12) They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
(Deut. 28:26; Jer. 7:33; 19:7; 34:20) The dead bodies of Your servants They have given as food for the birds of the heavens, The flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
Their blood they have shed like water all around Jerusalem, And there was no one to bury them.
We have become a reproach to our (Ps. 44:13; (Dan. 9:16)) neighbors, A scorn and derision to those who are around us.
